instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .

threads.title: Can <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> be bypassed without any negative effects?
threads.message: Have a macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with intermittent power issues. pin 2 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> getting power. tried replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> and same result. Is there any negative effects of making a solder blob of pin 2 and 4?

threads.title: Can <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> be bypassed without any negative effects?
threads.message:
If you bypass <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>, board will never start with original charger.
Can you post some measurments?

threads.title: Can <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> be bypassed without any negative effects?
threads.message: Ok. what measurements would you need?

threads.title: Can <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> be bypassed without any negative effects?
threads.message: Any voltage you can get around <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: Can <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> be bypassed without any negative effects?
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>
pin 2 -0.02 mV
pin 4 18.86v
pin 5  19.1v
pin 6  19.1v

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> 
pin 2 0.02mV
